intro: Hieracium argentinum, commonly known as the Argentine hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed areas, exhibiting a low-growing, herbaceous habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are usually reddish in color. Hieracium argentinum is known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it an invasive species in some regions.
